education.title: Fullstack Web Developer
education.description:
In my opinion, Udemy offers high-quality courses with industry professionals. Here are the courses I've taken on this platform:

React: The Complete Guide (incl. React Router & Redux)

This is a long but very comprehensive course covering everything from basic React concepts such as JSX, components, props, lifting state up, events, styles, etc., to intermediate and advanced concepts like hooks for managing state between components, such as useReducer and useContext, effects with useEffect, HTTP requests, routing with React Router, form validation, error handling, optimizations, global state with RTK, and best practices.

Next.js & React - The Complete Guide

This course teaches the basics of NextJS 13 and 14, including server components, image optimization, server actions, and some SSR. However, it is more focused on older versions of NextJS. Therefore, I have been updating myself with the official NextJS documentation and some YouTube tutorials to learn about authentication with NextAuth, middleware, and other topics.

CSS Bootcamp - Master CSS (CSS Grid / CSS Flexbox)

This is a very good course on positioning elements with flex and grid, which has helped me rely less on media queries when it comes to responsive design.

MERN From Scratch 2023 | eCommerce Platform

This course involves creating an ecommerce platform with the MERN stack. It's a real-world application and has helped me understand how to structure a fullstack application with React, Node, Express, and MongoDB. It also includes working with RTK Query to handle HTTP requests and cache them efficiently.

React Native - The Practical Guide

Possibly the most comprehensive React Native course I have seen online. The course is entirely based on creating various applications with Expo and React Navigation, incorporating device features like the camera, geolocation, push notifications, etc.

Other courses I am currently taking include one on C# and animations with CSS and JavaScript.
